segment.source: How to Add a Package
segment.target: How to Add a Package

segment.source: How to Add a Package
segment.target: How to Add a Package

segment.source: How to Add a Package
segment.target: How to Add a Package

segment.source: You can add a package from the Application Virtualization Server Management Console in the following ways:
segment.target: You can add a package from the Application Virtualization Server Management Console in the following ways:

segment.source: Import an application, which creates the package automatically in the process.
segment.target: Import an application, which creates the package automatically in the process.

segment.source: Add a package manually.
segment.target: Add a package manually.

segment.source: It is recommended that you import applications instead of adding them manually.
segment.target: It is recommended that you import applications instead of adding them manually.

segment.source: For more information about importing applications, see How to Import an Application.
segment.target: For more information about importing applications, see How to Import an Application.

segment.source: To add a package manually
segment.target: To add a package manually

segment.source: In the Application Virtualization Server Management Console, right-click the Packages node in the left pane and choose New Package.
segment.target: In the Application Virtualization Server Management Console, right-click the Packages node in the left pane and choose New Package.

segment.source: In the New Package dialog box, type a name in the Package Name field.
segment.target: In the New Package dialog box, type a name in the Package Name field.

segment.source: Browse for or type a path name in the Full path for package file field.
segment.target: Browse for or type a path name in the Full path for package file field.

segment.source: This must be an SFT file.
segment.target: This must be an SFT file.

segment.source: Note
segment.target: Note

segment.source: If you browse to the SFT file, replace the local path (such as C:Program FilesUserAppsVirtualAppServercontent) with the server's static host name or IP address.
segment.target: If you browse to the SFT file, replace the local path (such as C:Program FilesUserAppsVirtualAppServercontent) with the server's static host name or IP address.

segment.source: Using the variable %SFTSOFTGRIDSERVER% requires per-client computer configuration.
segment.target: Using the variable %SFTSOFTGRIDSERVER% requires per-client computer configuration.

segment.source: In dialog boxes that refer to Virtual Application Servers, you must use a network location, such as the server's static host name or IP address, that your users can access.
segment.target: In dialog boxes that refer to Virtual Application Servers, you must use a network location, such as the server's static host name or IP address, that your users can access.

segment.source: The application's Open Software Descriptor (OSD) file can replace the placeholder variable %SFTSOFTGRIDSERER% with the server's static host name or IP address.
segment.target: The application's Open Software Descriptor (OSD) file can replace the placeholder variable %SFTSOFTGRIDSERER% with the server's static host name or IP address.

segment.source: If you leave the placeholder variable, you must set this variable on each client computer that will access that server.
segment.target: If you leave the placeholder variable, you must set this variable on each client computer that will access that server.

segment.source: Set a User or System variable on each computer for SFTSOFTGRIDSERVER.
segment.target: Set a User or System variable on each computer for SFTSOFTGRIDSERVER.

segment.source: The variable value must be the server's static host name or IP address.
segment.target: The variable value must be the server's static host name or IP address.

segment.source: If you set a variable, exit the Client session, log out of and back into Microsoft Windows, and then restart the session on each computer that had a session running and had the variable set.
segment.target: If you set a variable, exit the Client session, log out of and back into Microsoft Windows, and then restart the session on each computer that had a session running and had the variable set.

segment.source: Click Next.
segment.target: Click Next.

segment.source: The Summary dialog box shows the file location and prompts you to copy the file to the location if you have not already done so.
segment.target: The Summary dialog box shows the file location and prompts you to copy the file to the location if you have not already done so.

segment.source: Click Finish after you have verified the information.
segment.target: Click Finish after you have verified the information.

segment.source: Note
segment.target: Note

segment.source: If you are managing applications on a remote server, in the next dialog box, type only the path of the file relative to the server's content root.
segment.target: If you are managing applications on a remote server, in the next dialog box, type only the path of the file relative to the server's content root.
